labels.analysis: The MCP Server focuses on enabling human-in-the-loop workflows in AI-assisted development tools. Its core functionality involves running commands, viewing outputs, and providing textual feedback directly to the AI to improve efficiency in development environments. The primary tool allows interactive feedback for a project directory and summary, reducing speculative tool calls and enhancing resource efficiency.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is selected because the server's main functionality is about facilitating human-AI collaboration, which is a key aspect of AI/ML Tools. The secondary label of Development Tools is chosen since the server aids in AI development and code-related tasks. A custom label of Human-AI Collaboration is used to emphasize the unique interactive feedback aspect not fully covered by existing categories.

tools.name: interactive_feedback

project_directory.title: Project Directory

server_info_crawled.name: Interactive Feedback
server_info_crawled.author: @QuantumLeap-us/interactive-feedback-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable a human-in-the-loop workflow in AI-assisted development tools by running commands, viewing their output, and providing textual feedback directly to the AI. Reduce costly speculative tool calls by consolidating interactions into a single feedback-aware request. Improve resource efficiency and performance in AI development environments.

tools.name: interactive_feedback
tools.description: Request interactive feedback for a given project directory and summary

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@QuantumLeap-us/interactive-feedback-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
